intro: Tarenna ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Tarenna ulugurensis is typically found in moist, shaded forest habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an endemic species contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
